author: Jeffrey D. Sachs
title: Achieving the Two-State solution in the wake of Gaza war - Pearls and Irritations
text:
Peace can come through the immediate implementation of the two-state solution, making the admission of Palestine to the United Nations the starting point, not the ending point.
The two-state solution is enshrined in international law and is the only viable path to a long-lasting peace. All other solutions‚Äîa continuation of Israel‚Äôs apartheid regime, one bi-national state, or one unitary state‚Äîwould guarantee a continuation of war by one side or the other or both. Yet the two-state solution seems irretrievably blocked. It is not. Here is a pathway.
The Israeli government strongly opposes a two-state solution, as does a significant proportion of the Israeli population, some on religious grounds (‚ÄúGod gave us the land‚Äù) and some on security grounds (‚ÄúWe can never be safe with a State of Palestine‚Äù). A significant proportion of Palestinians regard Israel as an illegitimate settler-colonial entity, and in any event distrust any peace process.
How then to proceed?
The usual recommendation is the following six-step sequence of events: (1) ceasefire; (2) release of hostages; (3) humanitarian assistance; (4) reconstruction; (5) peace conference for negotiations between Israel and Palestine ; and finally (6) establishment of two states on agreed boundaries. This path is impossible. There is a perpetual deadlock on steps 5 and 6, and this sequence has failed for 57 years since the 1967 war.
The failure of Oslo is the paradigmatic case in point. There are irreconcilable differences, such as the status of East Jerusalem. Israeli zealots would force from power any Israeli politician who dares to give up East Jerusalem to Palestinian sovereignty and Palestinian zealots would do the same with any Palestinian leader who gave up sovereignty over East Jerusalem. We should relinquish the continuing illusion that Israel will ever reach agreement, or that Palestine would ever have the negotiating power to engage meaningfully with Israel, especially when the Palestinian Authority is highly dependent on the US and other funders.
The correct approach is therefore the opposite, starting with the establishment of two states on globally agreed boundaries, notably the boundaries of June 4, 1967 as enshrined in UN Security Council and UN General Assembly resolutions. The UN member states will have to impose the two-state solution, instead of waiting for yet another Palestinian-Israeli failed negotiation.
Thus, the settlement should follow this order: (1) establishment of Palestine as 194th member state within two-state solution framework on June 4, 1967 borders; (2) immediate ceasefire; (3) release of hostages; (4) humanitarian assistance; (5) peacekeepers, disarmament and mutual security; and (6) negotiation on modalities (settlements, return of refugees, mutually agreed land-swaps, and others; but not boundaries).
In 2011, the State of Palestine (now recognised by 140 UN member states but not yet as a UN member state itself) applied for full UN member status . The UN Security Council Committee on New Members (constituted by the UN Security Council) recognised the legitimacy of Palestine‚Äôs application, but as is utterly typical in the ‚Äúpeace process,‚Äù the US government prevailed on the Palestinian Authority to accept ‚Äúobserver status,‚Äù promising that full UN membership would soon follow. Of course, it did not.
The Security Council, backed by the UN General Assembly, has the power under the UN Charter to impose the two-state settlement. It can do so as a matter of international law, following decades of relevant resolutions. It can then enforce the solution through a combination of carrots (economic inducements, reconstruction funding, UNSC-backed peacekeepers, disarmament, border security, etc.) and sticks (sanctions for violations by either party).
The only conceivable border for creating the two-state solution is that of June 4, 1967. Starting from that border, the two sides might indeed negotiate a mutually agreed swap of land for mutual benefit, but they would do so knowing that the ‚Äúbest alternative to a negotiated agreement‚Äù (BATNA) is the June 4, 1967 border.
It is quite possible, indeed likely, that the US would initially veto the proposed pathway. After all, the US has already used its veto multiple times to block merely a ceasefire . Yet, the process of eliciting the US veto and then securing a large majority vote in the UN General Assembly will be salutary for three reasons.
First, US politics is shifting rapidly against Israeli policies given the US public‚Äôs growing understanding of Israel‚Äôs war crimes and Israel‚Äôs political extremism. This shift in public opinion makes it far more likely that the US leaders will sooner rather than later accept the basic approach outlined here because of US domestic political dynamics. Second, the increasing US isolation in the UN Security Council and UN General Assembly is also weighing heavily on US leaders, and forcing the US leadership to reconsider its policy positions in view of geopolitical considerations. Third, a strong vote in the UNSC and UNGA for the two-state solution on June 4, 1967 borders will help to strengthen international law and the terms of the eventual settlement as soon as the US veto is lifted.
For these reasons, there is a realistic prospect that the UN will finally exercise its international legal and political authority to create the conditions for peace.
Twenty-two years ago, Arab and Islamic leaders affirmed in the 2002 Arab Peace Initiative that that the only pathway to peace is through the two-state solution. On February 7, 2024, the Saudi Ministry of Foreign Affairs reasserted that a comprehensive peace will only be achieved by recognising an independent Palestinian state on the 1967 borders and East Jerusalem as the capital. The Arab states and the world community generally shouldn‚Äôt buy into another vague peace process that is likely doomed to fail, especially given the urgency caused by the ongoing genocide in Gaza and the bad-will accumulated over the past 57 years of a fruitless ‚ÄúPeace Process.‚Äù
Peace can come through the immediate implementation of the two-state solution, making the admission of Palestine to the UN the starting point, not the ending point. Two sovereign states, on the boundaries of June 4, 1967, protected initially by UN-backed peacekeepers and other guarantees, will be the starting point for a comprehensive and just peace not only between Israel and Palestine‚Äîand also a regional peace that would secure diplomatic relations across the Middle East and end this conflict that has burdened the inhabitants, the region, and the world, for more than a century.
Republished from Common Dreams, March 5, 2024

author: HispanTV
title: Regreso de Galloway fortalece movimiento propalestino en Reino Unido | HISPANTV
text:
Por: Reza Javadi *
La C√°mara de los Comunes de Westminster fue testigo de un cambio s√≠smico la semana pasada cuando el destacado pol√≠tico brit√°nico George Galloway consigui√≥ una victoria decisiva y aplastante en las elecciones parciales de Rochdale, en el noroeste de Inglaterra.
Galloway, un defensor abierto y apasionado de la causa palestina, dedic√≥ la victoria a Gaza.
El fundador del Partido de los Trabajadores del reino Unido gan√≥ el esca√±o por 12 335 votos, sucediendo al difunto representante laborista Sir Tony Lloyd, cuya muerte en enero allan√≥ el camino para las elecciones parciales.
En su discurso de victoria, Galloway se refiri√≥ a la desilusi√≥n de los votantes con los partidos principales, calificando al primer ministro Rishi Sunak y al l√≠der de la oposici√≥n Sir Keir Starmer como ‚Äúdos mejillas del mismo trasero‚Äù.
‚ÄúAmbos recibieron una buena paliza esta noche aqu√≠ en Rochdale‚Äù, dijo Galloway.
‚ÄúEsto es para Gaza‚Äù , dijo el triunfante veterano pol√≠tico, dirigi√©ndose directamente al l√≠der laborista Starmer, quien ha sido criticado por la posici√≥n enga√±osa de su partido sobre el genocidio israel√≠ en Gaza.
‚ÄúHan pagado, y pagar√°n, un alto precio por el papel que han desempe√±ado al permitir, alentar y encubrir la cat√°strofe que est√° ocurriendo actualmente‚Äù, afirm√≥ Galloway, refiri√©ndose al genocidio de Gaza.
La contundente victoria en las elecciones parciales marc√≥ el √∫ltimo y m√°s significativo regreso pol√≠tico de Galloway, y refleja los sentimientos de millones de brit√°nicos hacia la crisis que se desarrolla en la Franja de Gaza.
Galloway se hizo eco de sus sentimientos y advirti√≥ que est√°n subrepresentados en los medios.
‚ÄúCreo que hablo en nombre de millones de personas en Gran Breta√±a cuyos corazones est√°n destrozados, cuyas entra√±as est√°n desgarradas por la masacre en Gaza. Y est√°n subrepresentados hasta el punto de casi ser invisibles en los medios brit√°nicos‚Äù, dijo despu√©s de su victoria el viernes.
‚ÄúIncluso esta noche, la clase pol√≠tica brit√°nica est√° en estado de p√°nico por [mi victoria], tanto los conservadores como los laboristas, porque saben que han sido derrotados‚Äù, recalc√≥.
En su reacci√≥n inicial a la victoria de Galloway, Sunak la calific√≥ de ‚Äúm√°s que alarmante‚Äù, acusando al diputado reci√©n elegido de extremismo y de sembrar divisi√≥n en el pa√≠s.
Galloway respondi√≥ a los comentarios de Sunak en una entrevista con el diario brit√°nico Sky News , que fue ampliamente compartida en las redes sociales, enfatizando su mandato democr√°tico y desafiando la credibilidad del primer ministro.
Galloway: Llego con un nuevo mandato para cesar la matanza en Gaza | HISPANTV El brit√°nico partidario de Palestina George Galloway, que gan√≥ los comicios del jueves, dice que lo primero que har√° es trabajar para detener la matanza en Gaza.
Les dijo a los periodistas que no hablaran del primer ministro brit√°nico como ‚Äúalguien que ha bajado del monte con tablas de piedra en la mano‚Äù.
Galloway rechaz√≥ a Sunak, haci√©ndose eco del desprecio de la gente hacia √©l como l√≠der de su pa√≠s y al mismo tiempo se√±alando el apoyo abrumador que recibi√≥ de los votantes.
‚Äú¬°Hablas [de √©l] como si fuera Dios! Estamos hablando del peque√±o Rishi Sunak en el final de su mandato de primer ministro‚Äù, dijo Galloway a un periodista en Rochdale.
‚Äú¬øQui√©n gan√≥ las elecciones? ¬øYo o Rishi Sunak? Yo tengo el mandato democr√°tico aqu√≠, no Rishi Sunak. Ni siquiera qued√≥ segundo. Tuvo suerte de quedar tercero‚Äù, se apresur√≥ a a√±adir.
Galloway, sin pelos en la lengua, dijo que ‚Äúdesprecia‚Äù al primer ministro brit√°nico como ‚Äúmillones de personas‚Äù en el Reino Unido, y agreg√≥ que ‚Äúno respeta al primer ministro en absoluto‚Äù.
Galloway prest√≥ juramento como diputado y fue presentado a la C√°mara de los Comunes por los diputados Sir Peter Bottomley y Neale Hanvey el lunes, solidificando su presencia en el panorama pol√≠tico de Westminster.
Diputado brit√°nico propalestino compara a Israel con la Alemania nazi Pol√≠tico inconformista que se atreve a desafiar Galloway, un legislador escoc√©s de 69 a√±os conocido por sus distintivos sombreros de fieltro y sus agudas r√©plicas, ha sido un pol√≠tico inconformista y ha desafiado habitualmente al establishment pol√≠tico del Reino Unido.
Exrepresentante laborista, fue expulsado en 2003 por el entonces primer ministro Tony Blair por oponerse a la invasi√≥n brit√°nico-estadounidense de Irak, denunciando a Blair y al entonces presidente estadounidense George W. Bush como ‚Äúlobos‚Äù.
Galloway se desempe√±√≥ como diputado del Partido Respeto pacifista en Bethnal Green and Bow de Londres (2005-2010) y Bradford West en el norte de Inglaterra (2012-2015), mostrando una inclinaci√≥n por la oratoria ardiente.
Su perspicacia pol√≠tica y su capacidad para conectarse con los votantes han sido reconocidas por todos.
Por ejemplo, Robert Ford, profesor de ciencias pol√≠ticas en la Universidad de Manchester, se refiri√≥ a sus notables habilidades para hacer campa√±a.
‚ÄúTiene una capacidad de campa√±a notable, es muy bueno para intuir las l√≠neas emotivas que aterrizar√°n en cualquier contexto particular, y lo ha demostrado una vez m√°s‚Äù, dijo Robert Ford, profesor de ciencias pol√≠ticas en la Universidad de Manchester.
¬øQu√© significa triunfo de Galloway en comicios parciales brit√°nicos? | HISPANTV La victoria del pol√≠tico brit√°nico George Galloway, conocido por su activismo propalestino y cr√≠ticas a la actuaci√≥n del Reino Unido ante Gaza, ha atrapado la atenci√≥n global. Lo que significa su victoria para la campa√±a propalestina en el Reino Unido Durante la campa√±a electoral, Galloway apel√≥ estrat√©gicamente al electorado musulm√°n, que constituye alrededor del 30 por ciento del electorado, y plante√≥ su defensa propalestina.
Hizo lo mismo en campa√±as exitosas anteriores en √°reas con importantes poblaciones musulmanas del sur de Asia, enfatizando su larga defensa de la causa palestina y su oposici√≥n a la ocupaci√≥n israel√≠ de Palestina.
Los observadores se√±alan que el apoyo de Galloway a un alto el fuego en Gaza, que resuena particularmente en la comunidad musulmana, refleja un sentimiento p√∫blico m√°s amplio, a pesar de una aparente desconexi√≥n en Westminster.
Si bien las figuras pol√≠ticas del establishment brit√°nico tal vez no est√©n muy impresionadas por la postura de Galloway sobre Gaza, el p√∫blico en general, como lo demuestran las recientes protestas, est√° abrumadoramente de su lado.
Gavin Barwell, exparlamentario conservador y jefe de gabinete de [la ex primera ministra brit√°nica] Theresa May, afirm√≥ que el llamado a un alto el fuego en Gaza cuenta con un amplio respaldo p√∫blico, disipando la noci√≥n de que es una posici√≥n extrema.
‚ÄúLos extremistas son una minor√≠a muy peque√±a, pero la verdad es que el pueblo brit√°nico apoya abrumadoramente un alto el fuego‚Äù, dijo Barwell.
Galloway, dirigi√©ndose a los cr√≠ticos dentro de la clase pol√≠tica y medi√°tica, destac√≥ que la mayor√≠a del p√∫blico brit√°nico simpatiza con las v√≠ctimas en Gaza m√°s que con los perpetradores israel√≠es.
‚Äú[La gente] dentro de la burbuja t√≥xica de la clase pol√≠tica y medi√°tica apoya el genocidio contra el pueblo de Gaza‚Äù, coment√≥ Galloway, distinguiendo a los apologistas sionistas del p√∫blico general en el Reino Unido.
‚ÄúPero cuando revientas esa burbuja, descubres, en realidad, que entre el p√∫blico en general ‚Äîincluso en un pa√≠s como Gran Breta√±a a pesar de todos sus defectos imperiales‚Äî la mayor√≠a de las simpat√≠as de la gente est√°n del lado de las v√≠ctimas y no de los perpetradores", a√±adi√≥.
Exclusive: ‚ÄòI‚Äôve arrived with fresh mandate to stop slaughter in Gaza‚Äô: George Galloway British politician George Galloway says he has ‚Äúarrived with a fresh mandate to stop the slaughter in Gaza.‚Äù Galloway adopta una postura firme contra la pol√≠tica laborista en Gaza La victoria de Galloway ha acentuado el creciente descontento dentro del partido laborista con respecto a su postura sobre la guerra de Gaza, considerada demasiado indulgente hacia Israel por muchos votantes musulmanes y pol√≠ticos laboristas musulmanes.
M√°s de 60 concejales laboristas en todo el pa√≠s dimitieron en protesta y, en noviembre de 2023, 56 parlamentarios laboristas desafiaron a la direcci√≥n del partido para apoyar el llamamiento del SNP (Partido Nacional Escoc√©s) a un alto el fuego inmediato en Gaza.
Durante su campa√±a, Galloway calific√≥ a Starmer de ‚Äúprincipal partidario de Israel‚Äù, insinuando posibles repercusiones para el liderazgo de Starmer. Se espera que el regreso de Galloway al Parlamento lo posicione como un cr√≠tico vocal del enfoque de su antiguo partido y un firme defensor de los derechos de los palestinos.
‚ÄúImag√≠nese: la gente de Rochdale se une para derrocar al odiado l√≠der laborista‚Äù, se√±al√≥ Galloway.
Galloway, en su discurso de victoria, declar√≥ enf√°ticamente que ‚Äútodos los platos se han movido esta noche‚Äù y el Partido Laborista hab√≠a ‚Äúperdido la confianza de millones de sus votantes‚Äù.
M√°s tarde, en una entrevista con Sky News , recalc√≥ que el l√≠der laborista hab√≠a ‚Äúvendido su alma al lobby de Israel‚Äù mientras defend√≠a su llamamiento ‚Äúdel r√≠o al mar‚Äù[en referencia a una Palestina libre desde el r√≠o Jord√°n hasta el mar Mediterr√°neo].
El Partido Laborista ahora enfrenta la perspectiva de perder terreno frente a candidatos independientes en distritos electorales con importantes votantes musulmanes, particularmente donde los parlamentarios se opusieron a la moci√≥n de alto el fuego del SNP en Gaza en noviembre de 2023.
La victoria de Galloway subraya la necesidad de que el Partido Laborista aborde las preocupaciones de los votantes sobre Gaza, desafiando el hist√≥ricamente supuesto apoyo del partido por parte de los votantes musulmanes, creen los observadores.
Apoyo a Galloway tras una aplastante victoria Tras la aplastante victoria de Galloway, cientos de sus partidarios se reunieron frente a Civic Suite en Catford, Lewisham, ondeando banderas palestinas y pancartas propalestinas, mientras el reci√©n elegido diputado asist√≠a a una elecci√≥n de alcalde de Lewisham en apoyo del candidato John Hamilton.
El respaldo de Galloway a John Hamilton, candidato del Partido de los Trabajadores de Gran Breta√±a que hace campa√±a para alcalde de Lewisham, a√±ade m√°s impulso y pone de relieve el genocidio que se est√° desarrollando en Gaza.
John Hamilton se ha hecho conocido por su lema de campa√±a ‚ÄúSi votas a los conservadores o a los laboristas, est√°s votando por el genocidio‚Äù.
‚ÄúCreo que la pol√≠tica ha cambiado, como resultado, no solo de mi victoria sino de la respuesta de p√°nico del gobierno‚Äù, dijo Galloway a la multitud.
Las redes sociales tambi√©n han sido un hervidero en las √∫ltimas semanas con internautas expresando su apoyo al nuevo representante de Rochdale en el parlamento brit√°nico, con la esperanza de que fortalezca el movimiento propalestino.
El apoyo a Galloway se produce en medio de una creciente ira contra el gobierno de Sunak y sus continuos env√≠os de armas al r√©gimen israel√≠ utilizadas contra los palestinos en Gaza.
La semana pasada, el Tribunal Superior del Reino Unido desestim√≥ un caso que ped√≠a el cese inmediato de las exportaciones de armas brit√°nicas a Israel. El caso fue presentado en diciembre por [la organizaci√≥n palestina de Derechos Humanos] Al-Haq y la Red Global de Acci√≥n Legal (Glan), con sede en el Reino Unido.
El desaf√≠o legal arroj√≥ luz sobre la venta de armas brit√°nicas al r√©gimen israel√≠ en todas las categor√≠as, incluidos componentes para radares militares, equipos de punter√≠a, aviones de combate y buques de guerra.
* Reza Javadi tiene un doctorado en estudios brit√°nicos de la Universidad de Teher√°n.

author: Natalie Vitelli
title: You Can Get Stanley Food Containers That Are Perfect for On the Go Meals
text:
As we all know, Stanley tumblers have become the next big thing.
Considering their latest tumbler duo for Valentine‚Äôs Day sold out at Target, it‚Äôs safe to say that Stanley isn‚Äôt moving over on the shelf‚Ä¶ and we don‚Äôt want it too!
But your Stanley tumbler at home, needs a friend.
The Stanley company, well known for its aesthetically pleasing tumblers, also have a slew of other items that are perfect for on the go trips!
Adding food bowls and jars to their resume list, Stanley has created to-go food containers that are efficient and just as pretty as their tumblers, because we all know, looks are everything.
We know what you‚Äôre thinking, matching one of these food containers to your tumbler at home would be the perfect scenario for your home office.
While both the bowls and jars include a double-wall vacuum insulation to keep your lunches, snacks or maybe even dinner at just the right temperature, you can also count on stuffing these containers with hot and cold foods.
You can
find Stanley‚Äôs on the go food jars and bowls currently stocked on Target store shelves.
And if they‚Äôre anything like their tumblers, we suggest rerouting your GPS to the retail store on your way home from work.

author: Luciano Fandi√±o
title: Ley √ìmnibus: el kirchnerismo y la Izquierda se retiraron del recinto en medio de los incidentes fuera del Congreso | Radio Mitre
text: Mientras continuaba el debate por la [Ley √ìmnibus](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/politica/el-gobierno-apunto-contra-la-oposicion-que-critico-la-ley-omnibus-hubo-dirigentes-que-no-se-tomaron-el-trabajo-ni-siquiera-de-leer-la-ley/), ocurrieron nuevos [incidentes fuera del congreso](https://radiomitre.cienradios.com/policiales/ley-omnibus-un-manifestante-resulto-herido-en-medio-de-la-marcha-al-congreso/) y debido a esto, fue que tanto el kirchnerismo, como la Izquierda se retiraron en se√±al de reclamo. El Gobierno se reunir√° con los gobernadores para acordar un pacto fiscal tras el debate por la Ley √ìmnibus La situaci√≥n que se hab√≠a agravado a lo largo de la tarde de hoy, mientras se continuaba con los debates por el proyecto de ley del presidente Javier Milei, termin√≥ con heridos y con la polic√≠a arrojando gases lacrim√≥genos contra los manifestantes. Fue la diputada de la Izquierda Romina del Pla, quien pidi√≥ llamar a un cuarto intermedio, mientras que criticaba duramente el accionar de las fuerzas policiales. De esta forma es como la funcionaria expres√≥: ‚ÄúSe esta produciendo una represi√≥n feroz sobre las manifestantes. En nombre de defender que no se corte una calle que est√° cortando la Gendarmer√≠a cada vez que avanzan y reprimen‚Äù. Por su lado, Victoria Tolosa Paz tambi√©n coment√≥: ‚ÄúEst√°n tirando gases, con un operativo represivo que no se condice con la gente que est√° en la plaza. No est√°n obstruyendo la v√≠a p√∫blica‚Äù. Adem√°s agreg√≥: ‚ÄúBajamos en una muestra de solidaridad con un pueblo que tienen derecho a expresarse en la plaza. Este no es un proyecto viable, con represi√≥n, atacando a diputados nacionales. Tenemos que prohibir la represi√≥n a un pueblo, es in√©dito‚Äù. Cecilia Moreau pidi√≥ suspender la sesi√≥n de la Ley √ìmnibus por los incidentes Mientras continuaban las sesiones a pesar de los incidentes con la polic√≠a fuera del congreso, la diputada de Uni√≥n por la Patria Cecilia Moreau pidi√≥ que se suspendiera la sesi√≥n de la Ley √ìmnibus. Carlos Cisneros apunt√≥ contra el DNU de Javier Milei: ‚ÄúNo voy a votar bajo ning√∫n punto de vista ninguna privatizaci√≥n‚Äù Seg√∫n coment√≥ en declaraciones para televisi√≥n: ‚ÄúLa idea es que se suspenda la represi√≥n. Agredieron a manifestantes y a la prensa. Hay que levantar la represi√≥n para seguir el debate con tranquilidad. Lo √∫nico que pedimos es que retiren a las Fuerzas de la calle.Yo baj√©, soy asm√°tica y el gas pimienta se siente en el aire‚Äù.

author: VNExplorer
title: Forget push-ups ‚Äî this 15-minute arm workout builds your triceps, pecs and shoulders in 15 moves
text:
Just like the best pulling exercises torch your back, rear delts and biceps, the best pushing exercises build your triceps, pecs and shoulders and strengthen your upper body.
The arm workout below takes 15 minutes to complete and requires one set of dumbbells. If you like to work with a few sets of weights, we recommend the best adjustable dumbbells so you can scale weights as you go, but otherwise, one set of light to medium weights works well.
((Image credit: Getty images/ Unknown))
For beginners, the dumbbell arm workout is better attacked with lighter weights, but we recommend checking out the exercises below first, giving them practice, then sticking to your weight selection.
If your lower back begins to arch or you notice yourself throwing the weights, stay accountable to your form, check you‚Äôre engaging your core properly and scale back.
Not only are you taking the intensity out of the exercise by throwing the weights and working the muscles less, but you won‚Äôt get the desired results from the workout, either.
Watch Fitbymik‚Äôs 15-minute arm workout with dumbbells: Sculpt and shape your arms and upper body using Fitbymik‚Äôs 15-minute barre arms workout. She uses 3lb dumbbells, but anything between 2-5lbs (or more if you dare) works. Barre workouts often follow endurance principles, meaning you‚Äôre more likely to adopt higher reps at lighter weights with some pulses thrown in for good measure and very little rest to ramp up the muscle-burn factor.
For the ‚Äúlean and toned arms‚Äù offered by Mik, and if building muscle definition is your goal, you‚Äôll need to train them consistently, several times a week and check in with other lifestyle factors like your diet.
The ‚Äúbro split‚Äù traditionally used by gym-goers (training body parts by days of the week) isn‚Äôt that efficient, so our advice is to prioritize multi-muscle and multi-joint moves ‚Äî called compound exercises ‚Äî and save isolation exercises and short arm workouts like these as finishers or a quick standalone session if you enjoy exercise snacking.
To strengthen and shape the arms and upper body muscles over time, we recommend splitting your upper body workouts into push or pull to prioritize your chest and triceps or back and biceps, respectively, or combining them into one upper body session for maximum efficiency.
‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt have dumbbells at home, just grab two full water bottles to use as weights,‚Äù says Mik. ‚ÄúEach move will be 45 seconds on and 15 seconds rest. So, let‚Äôs get toning!‚Äù
Trainer notes Mik encourages you to pull up through the spine to lengthen your back and practice squeezing the muscle groups you‚Äôre working to help improve activation and that all-important mind-muscle connection.
The connection between our brain and muscle actions is crucial to helping us properly engage the correct muscle groups and work them through a full range of motion. Growing amounts of research show that using your brain to give attention to specific muscle groups can increase muscle activation during resistance exercises.
It‚Äôs worth noting that although you‚Äôll work plenty of muscle groups in just 15 minutes, including the triceps, biceps, all three shoulder heads ‚Äî the anterior, lateral and posterior deltoids ‚Äî back and chest, it‚Äôs predominantly a front-body workout. That means your triceps, pecs and anterior deltoids are the key workers.
Mik utilizes one of my favorite techniques called time under tension by combining several moves into one, helping you recruit more muscles together and working your shoulder muscles hard throughout ‚Äî whatever the move. Despite the working set only lasting 45 seconds, combo moves up the ante and makes a short amount of time seem endless.
As always, Tom‚Äôs Guide advises you to stop if you experience sharp, persistent, or prolonged pain during exercise. Never continue past a 4 out of 10 on the pain threshold, and if you‚Äôre unsure or just returning to exercise, speak with a qualified medical professional or your trainer first.
I tailor arm and shoulder workouts to an existing rotator cuff injury, and while I didn‚Äôt need to modify during this workout, you might, so be mindful as you approach each move.
Finally, if you want to get stronger and build muscle, you‚Äôll need to strike a balance between lifting heavy enough to challenge your muscles (called overload) and keeping your form in check.
Beginners in particular can benefit from workouts like the above and may notice initial improvements faster than seasoned exercisers, but either way, this particular workout is muscular endurance-focused, meaning you‚Äôll primarily improve how long muscles can sustain movement and contraction.
Tom‚Äôs Guide

author: David Yapkowitz
title: Celtics booed by home crowd as Cade Cunningham, Pistons take massive halftime lead
text: The [Boston Celtics](/nba/boston-celtics) have [surged](https://clutchpoints.com/celtics-news-how-monster-kristaps-porzingis-creates-so-many-problems-helpless-opponents) to the best record in the NBA at 23-6 this season. They've looked like the top contender for the NBA championship, but on Thursday they showed that the NBA season is a grind and anything can happen on any given night. The Celtics came into Thursday set to square off against the league-worst [Detroit Pistons](/nba/detroit-pistons) who recently set a [not-so good](https://clutchpoints.com/pistons-news-cade-cunningham-respect-posts-flood-the-internet-amid-detroits-new-low) record. But that didn't matter so much as the Celtics went into halftime trailing by 19 points and heard [a chorus of boos](https://twitter.com/ClutchPoints/status/1740546346606821800) from the home crowd. ‚Äù Celtics fans are booing their team as Cade Cunningham and the Pistons go up 19 points üò¨ [pic.twitter.com/t3chUmhi3h] ‚Äî ClutchPoints (@ClutchPoints) [December 29, 2023] The Celtics were coming off a very successful four game West Coast road swing where they went 3-1 with wins against the Los Angeles Clippers, Los Angeles Lakers and Sacramento Kings. As well as they've played this season, it's understandable why Celtics fans would be disgusted with their performance in the first half against the Pistons. With the Pistons loss to the Brooklyn Nets on Tuesday, they officially set the record for the NBA's longest losing streak at 27 games. Even though the Celtics came into the game short-handed with Jaylen Brown out due to a back injury, this is still a game that the Celtics have no excuse for looking this poorly. It's true that the Pistons have actually been fighting and clawing during their losing streak, they just end up running out of gas and overmatched. It might be understandable if this game was close but the Celtics are literally getting blown out at home. Cade Cunningham had 22 points in the first half to lead the Pistons. Jayson Tatum had 16 to lead the Celtics.

author: Stephen Las Marias
title: ST Eases Development on Single-core MPUs
text:
STMicroelectronics has launched a new software for migrating STM32 MCU code to more powerful STM32MP1 MPUs.
STMicroelectronics is helping engineers raise the performance of embedded-system designs to the next level with new software for migrating STM32 microcontroller code to more powerful STM32MP1 microprocessors.
As end-users constantly demand more features and faster response from the technology that powers their daily lives and work, brands need effective solutions to boost product performance. Industrial real-time applications are typical. Increasingly, the latest process equipment, factory-automation systems, logistics and retail technology, IoT devices, and digital signage demand greater host-system performance than microcontrollers (MCUs) typically provide.
ST‚Äôs STM32MP1 microprocessors (MPUs) address these trends, bringing a powerful Arm Cortex-A7 application-class architecture with more processing power and memory. Users can now take advantage of the new software pack, STM32CubeMP13, to migrate code originally designed for smaller, simpler MCUs and unleash the higher-performance MPU‚Äôs extra capabilities in their next-generation products.
STM32CubeMP13 enables an embedded bare-metal application or RTOS on STM32MP13 SoCs, giving an alternative to OpenSTLinux that ensures faster execution times compared to typical microcontrollers. Users can also ensure ported code continues to meet the original implementation‚Äôs hard real-time specifications, such as interrupt times and latency. Moreover, an RTOS can leverage the MPU‚Äôs larger memory while preserving low power consumption.
Fully integrated in the STM32Cube ecosystem, STM32CubeMP13 lets designers already using ST‚Äôs STM32 embedded microcontrollers move up to higher-performance MPU-based projects within the same, familiar development environment. This includes the STM32CubeMX device configurator, STM32CubeIDE development tools, and STM32CubeProgrammer.
STM32CubeMP13 comes with all necessary components needed to run embedded code on STM32MP13 Arm Cortex-A7 MPUs, including the board support package (BSP) and hardware abstraction layer (HAL). Azure RTOS (moving to Eclipse ThreadX) comes pre-integrated as an example real-time operating system. Also, code samples are provided that help embedded developers handle the extra complexity of MPU-based systems, including booting from external memory and power management including DDR-RAM self-refresh control.
Entry-level applications leveraging STM32MP13, targeted at industrial, smart city, smart home, retail, medical, health, and wellness markets, can still be developed using the established ecosystem and OpenSTLinux distribution.
The software is available free of charge and ready to download now from
https://www.st.com/en/embedded-software/stm32cubemp13.html.
